text.sentence: Jon, I am unsure if you got my message the other day, but I am looking at doing around 20000 US worth of currency.
The bank last week was charging me a couple of hundred points, so anything less would be appreciated.
I would like to hold off longer, but my first tuition bill is due Sept 10, so I need the money by then.
If you can't help, I will probably try and cut a deal with my bank or a new bank down here.
How's about US$10,000 to get started or do you need US$20,000 right away?
I'm not sure Enron is going to do the trade with me but I would be glad to help you out.
Do you just want to mail cheques to each other or do something else?
If Enron does the currency trade that I want to do, I'd be happy to do what every volume you need.
Let me know what you want to do.
I would love to do closer to 15000, but 10 will definately work.
I have about 14000 in tuition bills due in several weeks, and need to definately convert some money.
Why don't you choose a rate, and e-mail me the rate and your address (work is probably best, although I don't believe I have any cards here and will need the address again!).
I will rush you a check, which you can cash and then rush me back a check.
I really appreciate your help, and will hopefully talk to you soon (we will have to talk one of these afternoons, as I am generally around and have no classes!).
How about 1.5460 as the rate.
I'll just send you a cheque for USD$20,000 and you can mail me the appropriate amount back.(Laura
Scott agreed to do the amount that I wanted to swap with her).
Where should I send the cheque?
Awesome, I owe you many beers when I get back at Christmas (assuming you are also home at xmas!).
You can send me the check to: Jeff Pearson T'03 Tuck School of Business 316 Byrne Hall Dartmouth College Hanover NH, 03755-9000 I will courier you a check for the money on Tuesday!
If possible, can you please also courier the check to me, I have to pay my tuition by the 10th and need to ensure that I have the money.
I will include an extra 15 on the check to cover the cost of the courier!
